One Level Up Top Level

ocaml/tools/ci/actions/deepen-fetch.sh - ocaml

  1. #!/usr/bin/env bash
  2. #**************************************************************************
  3. #*                                                                        *
  4. #*                                 OCaml                                  *
  5. #*                                                                        *
  6. #*                 David Allsopp, OCaml Labs, Cambridge.                  *
  7. #*                                                                        *
  8. #*   Copyright 2021 David Allsopp Ltd.                                    *
  9. #*                                                                        *
  10. #*   All rights reserved.  This file is distributed under the terms of    *
  11. #*   the GNU Lesser General Public License version 2.1, with the          *
  12. #*   special exception on linking described in the file LICENSE.          *
  13. #*                                                                        *
  14. #**************************************************************************

  16. # The aim of this script is to ensure that all the commits for a PR or branch
  17. # push are fetched. Particularly for long-lived PRs, the relevant commits for
  18. # the merge-base (i.e. the commit on trunk) will not be present by default.
  19. # For force pushes, the same can be true for branches (e.g. a rebase)
  20. # After running this script, 5 variables are available:
  21. #   - FETCH_HEAD - the merge commit for a PR or the tip of the branch of a push
  22. #   - UPSTREAM_BRANCH - the branch a PR is against or the full ref of the push
  23. #   - UPSTREAM_SHA - the tip of UPSTREAM_BRANCH (prior to push, if applicable)
  24. #   - PR_BRANCH - the PR's branch name; equal to $UPSTREAM_BRANCH for a push
  25. #   - PR_HEAD - the tip of PR_BRANCH (so, for a push, the new tip after pushing)

  27. # GitHub Actions doesn't support the ternary operator, so the dance is done here
  28. # Each script has:
  29. #   $1 - ref to fetch when deepening
  30. #   $2 - event type ('pull_request' or 'push')
  31. #   $3 - upstream branch name
  32. #   $4 - upstream branch SHA
  33. #   $5 - PR branch name
  34. #   $6 - PR SHA
  35. #   $7 - full ref being pushed
  36. #   $8 - upstream SHA prior to push
  37. #   $9 - repeats $7
  38. #  $10 - upstream SHA after the push
  39. FETCH_REF="${1}"
  40. if [[ $2 = 'pull_request' ]]; then
  41.   shift 2
  42. else
  43.   shift 6
  44. fi

  46. # Record FETCH_HEAD (if it hasn't been by a previous step)
  47. git branch fetch_head FETCH_HEAD &> /dev/null || true

  49. FETCH_HEAD=$(git rev-parse fetch_head)
  50. UPSTREAM_BRANCH="$1"
  51. UPSTREAM_HEAD="$2"
  52. PR_BRANCH="$3"
  53. PR_HEAD="$4"

  55. # Ensure that enough has been fetched to have all the commits between the
  56. # the two branches.

  58. NEW=0
  59. # Special case: new tags and new branches will have UPSTREAM_HEAD=0\{40}
  60. if [[ -z ${UPSTREAM_HEAD//0/} ]]; then
  61.   echo "$UPSTREAM_BRANCH is new: only testing HEAD"
  62.   UPSTREAM_HEAD="$PR_HEAD~1"
  63.   NEW=1
  64. elif ! git log -1 "$UPSTREAM_HEAD" &> /dev/null ; then
  65.   echo "$UPSTREAM_BRANCH has been force-pushed"
  66.   git fetch origin "$UPSTREAM_HEAD" &> /dev/null
  67. fi

  69. if ! git merge-base "$UPSTREAM_HEAD" "$PR_HEAD" &> /dev/null; then
  70.   echo "Determining merge-base of $UPSTREAM_HEAD..$PR_HEAD for $PR_BRANCH"

  72.   DEEPEN=50
  73.   MSG='Deepening'

  75.   while ! git merge-base "$UPSTREAM_HEAD" "$PR_HEAD" &> /dev/null
  76.   do
  77.     echo " - $MSG by $DEEPEN commits from $FETCH_REF"
  78.     git fetch origin --deepen=$DEEPEN "$FETCH_REF" &> /dev/null
  79.     MSG='Further deepening'
  80.     ((DEEPEN*=2))
  81.   done
  82. fi

  84. MERGE_BASE=$(git merge-base "$UPSTREAM_HEAD" "$PR_HEAD")

  86. if [[ $UPSTREAM_BRANCH != $PR_BRANCH ]]; then
  87.   echo "$PR_BRANCH branched from $UPSTREAM_BRANCH at: $MERGE_BASE"
  88. elif ((!NEW)); then
  89.   echo "$UPSTREAM_BRANCH branched at: $MERGE_BASE"
  90. fi
